Uses of Class
Agents.MetaAgent

  • Packages that use MetaAgent 
    Package Description
    Agents  

    • Uses of MetaAgent in Agents

      Subclasses of MetaAgent in Agents 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  NodeMonitor
      This class allows agents to display messages on a GUI application
      class  NodeMonitorOld
      This class allows agents to display messages on a GUI application PLEASE NOTE THIS CLASS IS NO LONGER IN USE BUT HAS STILL BEEN INCLUDED IN THE SOFTWARE/SUBMISSION FOR VIEWING PURPOSES THIS CLASS CREATES A NEW NODEMONITOR THAT WILL BE DISPLAYED ON A GUI THE USER WOULD HAVE TO MANUALLY CREATE A NEW NODEMONITOR FOR EACH PORTAL BUT NOW IT IS AUTOMATICALLY DONE
      class  Portal
      Contains all methods and functionality of the Portals
      class  UserAgent 
      Fields in Agents declared as MetaAgent 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected MetaAgent MetaAgent.parentAgent
      Stores the parent agent of the agent, which is a portal Called parentAgent as the name "portal" was confusing to work with
      Fields in Agents with type parameters of type MetaAgent 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.ArrayList<MetaAgent> NodeMonitor.activeAgents 
      Methods in Agents that return MetaAgent 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected MetaAgent MetaAgent.getScope()
      Method returns the scope of the agent
      protected MetaAgent MetaAgent.getScope(java.lang.String name)
      Method returns the scope by the name of the agent
      MetaAgent Portal.getScope(java.lang.String name)
      Method returns the scope of the agent
      Constructors in Agents with parameters of type MetaAgent 
      Constructor and Description
      MetaAgent(java.lang.String agentName, MetaAgent scope)
      Constructor - MetaAgent with a name, scope and starts a new thread.
      Portal(java.lang.String name, MetaAgent parentAgent)
      Constructor - Creates a new portal which sets the name and parent
      UserAgent(java.lang.String name, MetaAgent parentAgent, MetaAgent scope)
      Constructor - Sets the user agent's name, it's parent and the scope in which it is defined
